Seattle Opera: Daphne (Opening Night)

McCaw Hall

Richard Strauss's rarely performed one-act masterpiece. Heidi Stober makes her Seattle Opera debut in the title role. Conductor: David Afkham.

Seattle Art Museum (SAM)

Seattle Art Museum

Major art museum featuring Ai Weiwei: Water Lilies and contemporary exhibitions. First Thursday FREE, First Friday $5 for seniors.

2-3h$22★ must do
Senior: $5 admission on First Friday (Jan 2)

Seattle Asian Art Museum

Volunteer Park

Beautiful museum in Volunteer Park featuring Anila Quayyum Agha: Geometry of Light and Asian art collections.

2h$16should do

Chihuly Garden and Glass

Seattle Center

Stunning glass art exhibition by Dale Chihuly. Indoor galleries and outdoor garden.

1.5-2h$32★ must do

Frye Art Museum

Frye Art Museum

Always FREE art museum on First Hill. Current exhibitions include Jonathan Lasker drawings and contemporary works.

1.5hFREEshould do

Henry Art Gallery

University of Washington

UW campus art museum featuring contemporary exhibitions and James Turrell Skyspace installation.

1.5h$8nice to-have

Museum of Pop Culture (MoPOP)

Seattle Center

Music, sci-fi, and pop culture museum. Keith Haring exhibition and Follow the Yellow Brick Road film festival Jan 17-18.

2-3h$25should do
Senior: 65+ discount at box office with ID

Kubota Garden

Kubota Garden

Beautiful 20-acre Japanese garden. FREE admission year-round. Serene in winter with evergreens and water features.

1.5hFREE★ must do

WildLanterns at Woodland Park Zoo

Woodland Park Zoo

Magical lantern festival through January 18. Thousands of illuminated lanterns creating animal and nature scenes.

2026-01-11 @ 16:002h$24should do
Senior: 40% off with Holiday Senior Stroll discount
Book

Volunteer Park & Conservatory

Volunteer Park

Beautiful park with Victorian glass conservatory (tropical plants), water tower views, and connection to Asian Art Museum.

1.5hFREEshould do

Portland Japanese Garden

Washington Park

One of the most authentic Japanese gardens outside Japan. Peaceful winter visit with fewer crowds.

2h$20★ must do
Book

Pike Place Market

Pike Place Market

Iconic Seattle market. Fresh flowers, fish throwing, original Starbucks, local crafts and food.

2-3hFREE★ must do

Space Needle

Seattle Center

Seattle's iconic landmark. Observation deck with 360° views. Glass floor experience.

1h$37should do

Powell's City of Books

Powell's Books

World's largest independent bookstore! Spans a city block with over 500,000 books. Get a map!

2-3hFREE★ must do

Museum of Glass (Tacoma)

Museum of Glass

World-class glass art museum. Chihuly Bridge of Glass connects to downtown. Great stop on the way to Portland.

2h$21should do

Washington State Capitol

Washington State Capitol

Beautiful state capitol building. FREE guided tours. Great stop on the drive to Portland.

1.5hFREEnice to-have

Blade Runner Live in Concert

Benaroya Hall

Seattle Symphony performs Vangelis's iconic score live while the film plays on the big screen. A stunning audio-visual experience of the sci-fi masterpiece.

The Ruins (Various locations)

Intimate candlelit performance of Vivaldi's beloved Four Seasons by a string quartet. Baroque music in a magical atmosphere.

The Ruins (Various locations)

Experience Bach's greatest compositions performed by candlelight in an intimate setting.

Seattle Chamber Music Winter Festival

Nordstrom Recital Hall at Benaroya

Annual winter festival featuring world-class chamber music performances. Multiple concerts over the weekend.

2026-01-23 @ 20:002h$50should do
Book

The Seattle Series: Chamber Concert

Town Hall Seattle

Intimate chamber music performance at historic Town Hall. Features local and visiting musicians in an acoustically superb venue.

2026-01-16 @ 19:301h 30m$30nice to-have
Book

Candlelight: Baroque by Candlelight

Various Portland Venues

Baroque masterpieces performed by candlelight in intimate Portland venues. Features works by Bach, Vivaldi, and Handel.

2026-01-17 @ 19:001h$40should do
Book

FAN EXPO Portland

Oregon Convention Center

Major pop culture convention featuring celebrity guests, comics, anime, gaming, and more. Fun people-watching even if not deep into fandoms!

2026-01-16 @ 10:004-6h$55nice to-have

Powell's Books Author Events

Powell's City of Books

Powell's hosts author readings and signings almost daily. Check their calendar for January events - always FREE!

1hFREEnice to-have

Multnomah Falls

Columbia River Gorge

Oregon's tallest waterfall at 620 feet. Iconic Benson Bridge offers stunning views. Easy paved path to the bridge, steeper trail to the top.

1-2hFREE★ must do

Latourell Falls

Columbia River Gorge

Beautiful 249-foot plunge waterfall with easy trail access. Less crowded than Multnomah. Unique yellow lichen on basalt cliffs.

1hFREEshould do

Pittock Mansion

Pittock Mansion

1914 French Renaissance mansion with stunning views of Portland and Mt. Hood. Beautiful grounds even if you don't tour inside.

1.5h$13should do

Lan Su Chinese Garden - Lunar New Year

Lan Su Chinese Garden

Authentic Suzhou-style garden celebrating Lunar New Year through Jan 23! Stunning lantern sculptures, zodiac animals light show, and Dragon Dance procession.

1.5h$14★ must do

Horsetail & Ponytail Falls

Columbia River Gorge

Two stunning waterfalls! Horsetail Falls (176 ft) visible from parking lot. Short 0.4 mile hike to Ponytail Falls where you can WALK BEHIND the waterfall through a basalt cave!

1.5hFREE★ must do

Washington Park Arboretum

Washington Park Arboretum

Beautiful 230-acre botanical garden. Winter garden features witch hazels, camellias, and evergreens. Connected to Japanese Garden.

2hFREEshould do

Seattle Japanese Garden

Washington Park

Tranquil 3.5-acre garden within the Arboretum. Winter hours and peaceful atmosphere. Tea garden when open.

1.5h$9should do

National Nordic Museum

National Nordic Museum

Celebrate Nordic heritage with beautiful exhibits on Scandinavian history, art, and culture. Great cafe with Scandinavian treats.

2h$18nice to-have

Wing Luke Museum of Asian Pacific American Experience

Wing Luke Museum

Nationally recognized museum in Chinatown-International District. Walking tours and exhibits on Asian American history.

2h$14nice to-have

Kann Restaurant

Kann

#1 Best Restaurant in Portland 2025! James Beard Award-winning chef Gregory Gourdet serves Haitian-inspired cuisine. Wood-fired cooking, gluten/dairy-free. Try the warm sweet potato bread!

2h$85★ must do
Book

Le Pigeon

Le Pigeon

Multi-James Beard Award winner! Intimate 35-seat restaurant with French-forward tasting menus. Famous foie gras profiteroles since 2006. Chef's counter has kitchen views.

2.5h$140should do
Book

Mother's Bistro & Bar

Mother's Bistro

Perfect for mother-daughter! Elevated home cooking since 2000. Famous biscuits, pot roast, chicken & dumplings, and daily mac & cheese. Monthly "Mother of the Month" menu.

1.5h$35★ must do
Book

Screen Door

Screen Door

Portland institution! Southern-inspired comfort food. LEGENDARY fried chicken and waffles. Expect weekend waits but worth it.

1.5h$30should do

Pine Street Market

Pine Street Market

Curated food hall in beautiful 1886 building. Multiple vendors: ramen, Thai, dumplings, Costa Rican, mini donuts. Great when you can't decide!

1h$20should do

Jacqueline

Jacqueline

Pacific Northwest seafood gem. Famous $1 oyster happy hour 5-6pm daily! James Beard certified sustainable. Winter menu: miso butter scallops, mussels in cider.

1.5h$55should do
Book

Friends of Chamber Music: Intimate Concert

Private Residence

Intimate chamber concert featuring Sylvia Gray (piano) & Stacey Minkoff (viola). House concert format in a private Portland residence. Very special experience!

2026-01-18 @ 15:001.5h$100should do
Book

Portland Art Museum - NEW Rothko Pavilion

Portland Art Museum

$116 million expansion completed Nov 2025! New Mark Rothko Pavilion, Abstract Painting Exhibition, Native American Art Center with 3,500+ works. Van Gogh, Monet, Renoir.

3h$25★ must do

Transportation

Seattle→Portland
2026-01-16 at 09:00
3h - 3.5h
175 miles via I-5
Notes
  • •Stop at Tacoma Museum of Glass (~45 min from Seattle)
  • •Optional: Olympia State Capitol (~1.5 hrs from Seattle)
  • •Arrive Portland by early afternoon for hotel check-in at 4 PM
Portland→Columbia River Gorge
2026-01-17 at 10:00
45 min - 1h
30-40 miles east on I-84
Notes
  • •Multnomah Falls parking lot fills early on weekends
  • •Can visit multiple waterfalls: Latourell, Multnomah, Horsetail
  • •Check road conditions - can be icy in January
Portland→Seattle
2026-01-18 at 14:00
3h - 3.5h
175 miles via I-5
Notes
  • •Check out by noon, lunch in Portland before departing
  • •Arrive Seattle by early evening
SEA Airport→Downtown Seattle
30-45 min
Notes
  • •Link Light Rail: $3, runs every 6-15 min
  • •Rideshare (Uber/Lyft): $30-50 depending on traffic
  • •Taxi: ~$50-60 flat rate to downtown
